title: Sports Turf Technical Manager
occupationalSummary: <p>This occupation is found in professional facilities or venues of a particular sport or an estate of sports turf surfaces (e.g. independent school, university or professional sporting facility) that may be in multiple locations across regions, nationally or potentially internationally. This could include facilities, venues and/or estates of athletics, bowls, croquet, cricket, equine-related sports, football (association and American), golf course, lacrosse, rugby, tennis and/or other similar playing surfaces. <br /><br />The broad purpose of the occupation is to implement and monitor natural and artificial sports turf playing surface performance and construction. They have advanced technical skills to plan and prepare procedures to develop sports turf construction projects, maintain sports turf, renovate sports turf and lead others to attain high performing sports turf. They have analytical and technical skills to assess suitability and performance of resources, including contractors, for the construction, maintenance, and renovation of sports turf surfaces. They are typically the lead decision-makers for requesting and rationalising capital and operational expenditure related to sports turf maintenance and construction. <br /><br />In their daily work, an employee in this occupation interacts with employees working on the site, site owners, contractors and departmental heads in order to ensure the playing surfaces suit those planning to use them. <br /><br />An employee in this occupation will be responsible for leading on the management of sports turf operations, including the personnel, and/or have a consultancy capacity to lead and advise other managers of sports turf. They may have some supervisory responsibilities and will be required to oversee health and safety of the sports turf area at all times.</p>

duties.dutyDetail: Interpreting the characteristics of the soil environment and how these impact on turfgrass plant growth and playing surface performance.
Critically appraising playing surface performance using a range of testing procedures and equipment.
Evaluating machinery and energy sources to appraise the optimum utilisation of power and equipment.
Providing technical advice and project managing the design concepts of sports turf constructions, including natural, hybrid, artificial, irrigation and drainage systems.
Managing small- and large-scale on-site projects from design, tender and delivery working to agreed specification of works.

Managing sports turf sustainably by understanding how turfgrasses interact with their environment and how turfgrass physiology is influenced by changes in environmental conditions, such as those associated with climate change.
Managing employees and contractors, including workforce planning, quality, health and safety, skills, motivation, recruitment, retention, and training.
Interpreting results of scientific investigations and literature.
Being responsible for budgeting, setting priorities, forecasting, driving efficiencies, procurement, Profit and Loss reporting and sourcing funding where applicable.
Interpreting and presenting information in a relevant and professional style.
A commitment to personal and professional development, maintaining awareness of industry developments and assessing how these will impact their organisation.
